conbody.p: A keyboard shortcut represents a sequence of keyboard keys. It can be associated to any menu item. At runtime, when a particular keyboard shortcut is entered by the user, the underlying pageflow is automatically executed and the associated page is displayed.
Keyboard shortcuts must be unique in each menu model.

Format
The string representation of the shortcut keys is Modifier[+Modifier..]+Key.
The modifiers represent the key Ctrl, Alt or Shift. They are optional
The Key is mandatory
The keys are case insensitive
Example: Ctrl+A, Alt+F12, B
The function keys F1, F2, ... F2 are valid

The following special keys are not allowed:
Esc, Tab, Space, Insert, Delete, Enter, Return
Home, End, Page_up, Page_down
Left, Up, Right, Down
Scroll_lock, Caps_lock, Num_lock
Existing keyboard shortcuts in Operating System and/or Internet Browser can't be overridden by this feature. Exemple: Ctrl+Esc, Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V, Ctrl+R, etc.
